meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be deterred.
meanings.sent1: Her deterrabilities were evident when she chose not to engage in risky behavior.
meanings.sent2: The deterrabilities of the security system prevented any break-ins.
meanings.sent3: The deterrabilities of the mischievous puppy were put to the test when he saw the 'Beware of Dog' sign.
meanings.sent4: The deterrabilities of the new alarm system were like a fortress protecting the house.
meanings.sent5: The deterrabilities of the warning signs made it clear that trespassing was not a good idea.

meanings.definition: The state of being capable of being deterred.
meanings.sent1: The criminal's deterrabilities were low, leading to repeated offenses.
meanings.sent2: In a peaceful society, deterrabilities play a crucial role in maintaining order.
meanings.sent3: The deterrabilities of the sleepy cat were challenged by the sight of a mouse.
meanings.sent4: His deterrabilities were like a shield against temptation.
meanings.sent5: The deterrabilities of the warning signs made it clear that trespassing was not a good idea.
